articles.title: National art exhibition opens
articles.content:
National art exhibition opens
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A national art exhibition on the subject "the great leader comrade Kim Il Sung will always be with us" was open at the Korean Art Gallery on Friday with due ceremony with the approach of the 5th anniversary of his demise.
   On display at the exhibition hall were Korean paintings, oil paintings, graphic paintings and other art works, more than 100 pieces in all. They depict undying revolutionary feats performed by President Kim Il Sung while leading the struggle to achieve the popular masses' cause of independence, the greatness of the respected Marshal Kim Jong Il, the revolutionary faith and heroic struggle of the Korean people upholding the Marshal's idea and leadership with loyalty.
   Present at the opening ceremony was Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea.

articles.title: Committees for remembering Kim Il Sung formed
articles.content:
Committees for remembering Kim Il Sung formed
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Committees for remembering the President Kim Il Sung were formed in Egypt and Abuja and Lagos of Nigeria between June 23 and 27.    Ahmad Abdul Tawab, first vice-Minister of Trade and Supply of Egypt, was elected chairman of the Egyptian committee and the chairman of the Nigerian Journalists Union was elected chairman of the Abuja regional committee

Meeting and film show on day of Sudanese revolution
articles.content:
Meeting and film show on day of Sudanese revolution
    Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting and a film show were held at the Pyongyang International House of Culture on Friday on the occasion of the 10th anniversary of the Sudanese revolution.   Abdel Hameed Abdeen Mohammad, Sudanese ambassador to the DPRK, was invited there.   Present there were Song Sok Hwan, vice-Minister of Culture and chairman of the DPRK-Sudan Friendship Association, other officials concerned and working people in the city.   The participants saw a Sudanese documentary film and talked with each other, deepening the friendly feelings.

Greetings to Rwandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Rwandan President
   Pyongyang, July 3 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Friday sent a message of greetings to President Bizimungu Pasteur on the National Day of the Republic of Rwanda.   Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, kim in the message wished the Rwandan President and people great success in their efforts for national unity and peace and prosperity of the country.
